Target: OntoHeatwave is an ontology developed to represent heatwave hazard

Comment: A sudden and violent shaking of the ground, caused by movements within the earth’s crust.
Label: heatwave

Comment: A potentially harmful event or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury, property damage, or environmental disruption.
Label: Hazard

Comment: Describing its intensity of heat
Label: Heatwave

Comment: Relates an event or phenomenon to a specific period or duration of time.
Label: has Time Interval

Comment: A hazard initiates or contributes to the occurrence of another hazard
Label: triggers

Comment: A phase in the progression of a hazard event that represents a specific period in the hazard’s lifecycle, from its initiation to its dissipation.
Label: Stage

Comment: The initial phase of hazard formation, where the necessary conditions for the event begin to develop.
Label: Embryonic Stage

Comment: The phase where the hazard starts gaining intensity and spreading.
Label: Growth Stage

Comment: The peak or most intense phase of the hazard, causing the most damage and destruction.
Label: Mature Stage

Comment: The phase where the hazard starts to weaken, dissipate, or recede, though residual impacts may persist.
Label: Decaying Stage

Comment: This property describes the different phases or stages that a hazard event undergoes.
Label: has Stage

Comment: This property indicates a temporal relationship where one event or stage occurs before another.
Label: preceded By

Comment: The measurable magnitude or severity of a heatwave
Label: Intensity

Comment: Links a heatwave to its intensity classification, indicating how severe the heatwave is.
Label: has Intensity

Comment: Represents the total duration of a heatwave in terms of time.
Label: has Duration

Comment: Records the highest temperature reached during a heatwave
Label: has Maximum Temperature

Comment: Represents the average temperature recorded over the duration of a heatwave
Label: has Average Temperature

Comment: Indicates the humidity percentage associated with a heatwave, which influences perceived heat and health impacts.
Label: has Humidity Level

Comment: Natural components of the environment (e.g. biodiversity, natural habitats, animal species, etc.).
Label: Environmental component

Comment: including humans and animals, that may be impacted by earthquakes.
Label: Living Being

Comment: People who inhabit a territory or state.
Label: Population

Comment: Non-human living organisms potentially affected by a hazard
Label: Animal

Comment: Manmade basic structures or features needed for the functioning of a system or organization.
Label: Infrastructure component

Comment: A relationship between a Hazard and affected entities.
Label: affects

Comment: Hazards can contaminate water bodies, leading to pollution, reduced water quality, and harm to aquatic life.
Label: Water

Comment: Hazards can pollute air affecting air quality and leading to health issues in humans and ecosystem.
Label: Air

Comment: Hazards can contaminate soil, reducing soil fertility, harming plant growth, and posing risks to human and animal health through food chains.
Label: Soil

Comment: Hazards can damage or destroy plant life, reducing biodiversity, and disrupting ecosystem.
Label: Vegetation

Comment: Hazards can disrupt ecosystem balance to long-term environmental degradation.
Label: Ecosystem

Comment: Network systems, i.e. installations and facilities spreading across land.
Label: Network infrastructure

Comment: Areal installations and land-uses.
Label: Areal infrastructure

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure to enable transport of people and goods (e.g. roads, railroads).
Label: Mobility network

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure for provisioning goods (e.g. electricity, gas, water).
Label: Provisioning network

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of residential buildings.
Label: ResidentialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of commercial buildings.
Label: CommercialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of industrial buildings.
Label: IndustrialArea

Comment: Consequences of an event taking place.
Label: Impact

Comment: A relationship between an Event and its effects.
Label: results in

Comment: A relationship between an Impact and the quantification of its cumulative effects in monetary terms.
Label: has monetary value

Comment: This property links a hazard to the quantity representing the loss of life it causes.
Label: causes Loss Of Life Of

Comment: This property associates a hazard with the quantity representing the number of evacuations it causes.
Label: causes Evacuation Of

Comment: This property connects a hazard to the quantity representing the entities it endangers.
Label: endangers Of

Comment: This property links a hazard to the quantity representing the damage it causes.
Label: cause Damage Of

Comment: This property associates a quantity with the environmental component, population, or infrastructure component it indicates.
Label: indicates Quantity Of

Comment: A relationship between an affected Infrastructure Component and the corresponding area affected.
Label: has affected area

Comment: A set of actions, technologies, or policies designed to reduce or counteract the effects of heatwaves in urban and natural environments.
Label: Mitigation Strategy

Comment: Materials specifically designed or selected to reduce heat absorption and enhance thermal comfort in buildings and urban spaces.
Label: Cooling Materials

Comment: A classification of materials based on their physical or chemical properties, affecting their thermal behavior and suitability for heat mitigation.
Label: Material Type

Comment: The visual appearance of a material, which influences its solar reflectance and heat absorption properties, impacting urban heat island mitigation.
Label: Material Colour

Comment: Vegetation-based solutions, including urban forests, green roofs, and vertical gardens, that contribute to cooling and climate resilience.
Label: Greenery

Comment: Specific types of plants used in urban environments for heat mitigation, selected based on their adaptability, shading potential, and evapotranspiration efficiency.
Label: Plant Species

Comment: A natural or artificial cooling process where water evaporates to absorb heat, reducing ambient temperature in urban and indoor environments.
Label: Evaporative Cooling

Comment: Natural or artificial water features, such as lakes, ponds, and fountains, that contribute to local cooling through evaporation and thermal regulation.
Label: Water Body

Comment: A set of measurable criteria used to evaluate the effectiveness of heat mitigation strategies in reducing urban heat and improving thermal comfort.
Label: Performance Metrics

Comment: Indicators that assess the ecological and climatic benefits of heat mitigation measures, such as temperature reduction, air quality improvement, and biodiversity support.
Label: Environmental Metrics

Comment: Measures that evaluate the impact of heat mitigation strategies on human well-being, including health benefits, comfort levels, and accessibility.
Label: Social Metrics

Comment: Financial and cost-related indicators used to assess the economic viability, return on investment, and cost-effectiveness of heatwave mitigation strategies.
Label: Economic Metrics

Comment: Specifies the actions taken in response to a heatwave.
Label: action Taken

Comment: Refers to the department responsible for the response.
Label: response By

Comment: Denotes the logistics used during the response to a heatwave.
Label: used Logistics

Comment: Identifies the input parameters used for heatwave forecasting.
Label: has Input Parameter

Comment: Connects an input parameter to its data source.
Label: has Data Source

Comment: Specifies the location for which a heatwave forecast is made.
Label: has Forecast Location

Comment: Relates an evaporative cooling system to a nearby or associated water body that contributes to the cooling effect.
Label: attached water body

Comment: Represents the measured reduction in air temperature due to a specific cooling intervention or strategy.
Label: has Air Temperature Reduction

Comment: Indicates the amount of energy saved as a result of implementing cooling technologies or strategies.
Label: has Energy Saving

Comment: A numerical value representing the level of thermal comfort achieved by a cooling intervention based on environmental and human comfort parameters.
Label: has Thermal Comfort Index

Comment: Specifies the temperature at which a cooling material transitions from a solid to a liquid state.
Label: has Melting Temperature

Comment: Represents the ability of a cooling material to reflect solar radiation, affecting its cooling efficiency.
Label: has Solar Reflectivity Index

Comment: Indicates the depth of tree roots or the density of tree coverage, which influences cooling effects and water absorption.
Label: has Tree Dept

Comment: Measures the percentage of land area covered by the tree canopy, impacting shading and cooling effects.
Label: has Tree Canopy Coverage

Comment: Represents the amount of water that can evaporate from a cooling system, influencing its cooling efficiency.
Label: has Evaporation Capacity

Comment: Specifies the spatial extent or effectiveness of an evaporative cooling system in reducing temperature.
Label: has Cooling Range

Comment: A notification issued based on predictive analysis or real-time monitoring indicating potential or imminent Heatwave risk in a specific area.
Label: Heatwave alert or warning

Comment: Area for which a Heatwave warning or alert service is provided (i.e. area to which a Heatwave warning/alert applies).
Label: Heatwave area

Comment: A collection of all previously issued Heatwave warnings and alerts.
Label: Heatwave alert or warning history

Comment: A relationship between a Heatwave Area and its collection of previous Heatwave warnings and alerts.
Label: has historical warning

Comment: A relationship between the collection of previous Heatwave warnings and alerts and their actual time series history.
Label: has time series

Comment: The potential impact of the Heatwave associated with a Heatwave warning/alert.
Label: Severity

Comment: Heatwave alert/warning indicating that Heatwave is possible (i.e. one should be prepared).
Label: Heatwave alert

Comment: Heatwave alert/warning indicating that Heatwave is expected (i.e. immediate action required).
Label: Heatwave warning

Comment: Heatwave alert/warning indicating that the Heatwave warning is no longer active.
Label: Inactive Heatwave Warning

Comment: Heatwave alert/warning indicating that severe Heatwave is expected (i.e. danger to life).
Label: Severe Heatwave warning

Comment: A relationship between a Heatwave Alert/Warning and its severity.
Label: has severity

Comment: A forecast of Heatwave risk providing the indication of potential landsliding a few days into the future.
Label: Heatwave forecast

Comment: A measure of hazard potential defined by expected likelihood and forecasted impact.
Label: Risk level

Comment: The probability of a forecasted Heatwave event.
Label: Likelihood

Comment: The potential impacts of a forecasted Heatwave event.
Label: Potential impact

Comment: A computational model that predicts potential Heatwave events based on Heatwave, meteorological, and geographic data.
Label: Heatwave Forecast Model

Comment: An object property that specifies that a Heatwave alert or warning is generated based on heatwave forecast
Label: is Based On Dataset

Comment: A relationship between a Heatwave forecast and its anticipated risk.
Label: has risk level

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying likelihood.
Label: has likelihood

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying impact potential.
Label: has potential impact

Comment: A relationship between a Heatwave Alert/Warning and the actual Heatwave event it refers to.
Label: warns about

Comment: A computational model that predicts potential Heatwave events based on Heatwave, meteorological, and geographic data.
Label: is Based On

Comment: A relationship between a (forecasted) event and its geospatial location.
Label: has location

Comment: A collection of structured data related to past and predicted Heatwave events
Label: Heatwave Dataset

Comment: A dataset containing weather-related data.
Label: Meteorological Dataset

Comment: A structured collection of related data points used for analysis, modeling, or decision-making.
Label: Dataset

Comment: A measurable characteristic or attribute of an entity.
Label: Property

Comment: A geographic or environmental entity, that is being observed or analyzed.
Label: Feature Of Interest

Comment: A recorded value representing a property of a feature of interest, obtained through observation or sensors.
Label: Measurement

Comment: A device that detects and records environmental data for Heatwave monitoring.
Label: Sensor

Comment: A defined time period over which measurements or observations are aggregated or analyzed.
Label: Interval

Comment: An object property that associates a property with a specific time interval during which measurements are taken.
Label: has Measurement Interval

Comment: An object property that links a property to the sensor responsible for measuring it.
Label: is Measured By

Comment: An object property that connects a property to the corresponding measurement data.
Label: has Measurement

Comment: An object property that indicates that a HeatwaveDataset contains a specific property related to Heatwave measurements.
Label: contains Property

Comment: A data property that defines the starting time of a measurement event.
Label: measurement Starttime

Comment: A data property that defines the ending time of a measurement event.
Label: measurement Endtime

Comment: Heatwave forecast model generates forecast
Label: generates

Comment: The geographical position where an event or entity is situated.
Label: Location

Comment: A record of past Heatwaves including relevant data and time series.
Label: Heatwave History

Comment: A sequence of data points measured at successive time intervals.
Label: Time Series

Comment: A digital vector storage format for storing the location, shape, and attributes of geographic features.
Label: Shape File

Comment: An entity that produces data, reports, or manages resources related to Heatwave events.
Label: Organization

Comment: A URL link that points to a file containing relevant information or data.
Label: File Url

Comment: Links an Heatwave occurrence to the location where it took place
Label: occurred In

Comment: Links an event to the geographic location where it occurred.
Label: has Location

Comment: Connects a location to its associated Heatwave history.
Label: has Heatwave History

Comment: Associates Heatwave history with a time series of data points.
Label: has Time Series

Comment: Refers to the shapefile associated with a specific location.
Label: has Shape File

Comment: Indicates the geometric representation of a location.
Label: has Geometry

Comment: Identifies the organization that produced a shapefile.
Label: is Produced By

Comment: Points to the URL of the shapefile.
Label: has File Url

Comment: This property represents the altitude of a specific location, expressed as a floating-point number.
Label: has Altitude

Comment: This property represents the latitude coordinate of a specific Heatwave location, expressed as a floating-point number.
Label: has Lat

Comment: This property represents the longitude coordinate of a specific Heatwave location, expressed as a floating-point number.
Label: has Lon

Comment: This property represents the timestamp of the most recent update related to the Heatwave situation.
Label: last Update On
